summary: The 'Veterans Cannabis Use for Safe Healing Act' aims to protect veterans who participate in state-approved marijuana programs. It prohibits the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) from denying benefits to veterans based on their marijuana use within state-approved programs. It also mandates VA physicians and healthcare providers to discuss marijuana use with veterans, adjust treatment plans accordingly, and record usage in medical records. Additionally, the bill authorizes VA healthcare providers to offer recommendations to veterans regarding participation in state-approved programs.
